title: ASL 5.1 ‚Äî Deaf Culture Basics üëêüåç
objectives: Identify key concepts in Deaf culture (COMMUNITY, DEAF-WORLD, IDENTITY)
Introduce cultural vocabulary (DEAF, HARD-OF-HEARING, HEARING, CODA)
Recognize the difference between medical and cultural models of deafness

vocab.def: Index finger from ear to mouth; identity, not just condition.
H-hand makes small hops along midline.
Index finger circles in front of lips; describes hearing people.
Shared language, values, traditions of Deaf people.
Relating to self and group membership.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Culture Words
sections.body: Drill **DEAF, HARD-OF-HEARING, HEARING** slowly. Focus on meaning difference ‚Äî not just sign shape.

microCheck.q: Which sign means cultural community, not just a medical condition?

sections.heading: Model: Cultural vs. Medical View
sections.body: Medical model = problem/deficit. Cultural model = identity/language. Example: **DEAF PROUD COMMUNITY.**

sections.heading: Community & Identity
sections.body:
Signs: **COMMUNITY, DEAF-WORLD, IDENTITY**. Practice in short clauses:
‚Ä¢ **DEAF COMMUNITY STRONG.**
‚Ä¢ **I DEAF IDENTITY PROUD.**

sections.heading: Partner Practice: Introductions
sections.body: Introduce with cultural lens: **I DEAF.** or **I CODA.** Add: **I LEARN ASL CONNECT COMMUNITY.** Swap turns.

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **10‚Äì15s**: introduce yourself, then explain why Deaf culture is important. Example: **I HEARING, LEARN ASL, WANT CONNECT DEAF-WORLD.**

items.q: Which model sees deafness as identity and culture?
Write a gloss for: I am hearing, I learn ASL, I want connect Deaf community.

items.prompt: What does Deaf culture add beyond language? How does it shape identity?

reflectionPrompt: Post a clip: introduce yourself with cultural lens (DEAF, HOH, HEARING, CODA) and one sentence about community.
summary: You explored Deaf culture basics: DEAF, HOH, HEARING, CODA, COMMUNITY, IDENTITY. You contrasted medical vs cultural models and connected to community pride.
